sentence.Network_en: The turning point in the process of growing up is when you discover the core of strength within you that survives all hurt.
sentence.Network_cn: 当你从内心深处找到一种可以忍受一切痛苦的坚强力量时，你的成长历程就会出现飞跃。

sentence.Network_en: Behind the mocking laughter lurks a growing sense of unease.
sentence.Network_cn: 嘲笑声的背后潜伏着一种越来越强烈的不安。

sentence.Network_en: McKay walked slowly toward this screen, feeling a growing tenseness.
sentence.Network_cn: 麦凯缓缓地朝这个屏幕走来，每走一步心情都更加紧张。

entry.def: When people, animals, and plants grow, they increase in size and change physically over a period of time.

example.tran: 我们成年之后不再长个儿。

entry.def: If a plant or tree grows in a particular place, it is alive there.

example.ex: The station had roses growing at each end of the platform.
example.tran: 车站月台的两头种着玫瑰花。

entry.def: If you grow a particular type of plant, you put seeds or young plants in the ground and look after them as they develop.

example.ex: I always grow a few red onions...
example.tran: 我总是喜欢种一些红洋葱。

example.ex: Lettuce was grown by the Ancient Romans.
example.tran: 古罗马人最先种植莴苣。

entry.def: When someone's hair grows, it gradually becomes longer. Your nails also grow.

example.ex: Then the hair began to grow again and I felt terrific.
example.tran: 然后，头发又长起来了，我感觉棒极了。

entry.tran: 留长（头发或指甲）；蓄（胡须）
entry.def: If someone grows their hair, or grows a beard or moustache, they stop cutting their hair or shaving so that their hair becomes longer. You can also grow your nails.

example.ex: I'd better start growing my hair.

entry.def: If someone grows mentally, they change and develop in character or attitude.

example.ex: They began to grow as persons.

entry.def: You use grow to say that someone or something gradually changes until they have a new quality, feeling, or attitude.

example.ex: I grew a little afraid of the guy next door...
example.tran: 我开始有些害怕隔壁的那个家伙。

entry.def: If an amount, feeling, or problem grows, it becomes greater or more intense.

example.ex: The number of unemployed people in Poland has grown by more than a quarter in the last month...
example.tran: 上个月，波兰的失业人数增长超过了1/4。

example.ex: Opposition grew and the government agreed to negotiate.
example.tran: 反对的声音越来越高，政府只好同意进行谈判。

entry.def: If one thing grows into another, it develops or changes until it becomes that thing.

example.tran: 这些男孩子长成了男子汉。

example.ex: This political row threatens to grow into a full blown crisis.
example.tran: 这场政治争端有可能演化成一场全面爆发的危机。

entry.def: If something such as an idea or a plan grows out of something else, it develops from it.

example.ex: The idea for this book grew out of conversations with Philippa Brewster.
example.tran: 创作这本书的想法来源于跟菲莉帕·布鲁斯特的谈话。

entry.def: If the economy or a business grows, it increases in wealth, size, or importance.
If someone grows a business, they take actions that will cause it to increase in wealth, size, or importance.

example.ex: To grow the business, he needs to develop management expertise and innovation across his team.
example.tran: 为了拓展业务，他需要提高整个团队的管理技能和创新能力。

entry.def: If a crystal grows, or if a scientist grows it, it forms from a solution.

example.ex: ...crystals that grow in cavities in the rock...
example.tran: 岩石洞穴中形成的水晶

example.ex: We tried to grow some copper sulphate crystals with our children.
example.tran: 我们想跟孩子们一起制作硫酸铜晶体。

means.word_mean: 1. (biology) the process of an individual organism growing organically; a purely biological unfolding of events involved in an organism changing gradually from a simple to a more complex level;

sentences.sentence: "he proposed an indicator of osseous development in children"

means.word_mean: 2. (electronics) the production of (semiconductor) crystals by slow crystallization from the molten state
1. increasing in size or degree or amount;
2. having or showing vigorous vegetal or animal life;
3. relating to or suitable for growth;

auth_sentence.content: Online bullying is rapidly growing in frequency and intensity.
auth_sentence.res_content: Online bullying is rapidly growing in frequency and intensity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Online bullying is rapidly growing in frequency and intensity.

auth_sentence.content: So males at least do benefit from growing larger.
auth_sentence.res_content: So males at least do benefit from growing larger.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So males at least do benefit from growing larger.

auth_sentence.content: Introducing is the sound of Joss growing up musically.
auth_sentence.res_content: Introducing is the sound of Joss growing up musically.

Sentence.sentence: The project is a growing one and is spread from the park to the school and the shopping center.
A growing number of Americans are seeing the accumulation and distribution of computerized date as a frightening invasion of their privacy.
Surveys show that the number of worried Americans has been steadily growing over the years as the computer becomes increasingly efficient, easier to operate, and less costly to purchase and maintain.

But rarely, if ever, do they publicly take the argument a step further, asserting that a growing manufacturing sector encourages craftsmanship and that craftsmanship is, if not a birthright, then a vital ingredient of the American self-image as a can-do, inventive, we-can-make-anything people.
In processing foods after the agricultural stage, there are large additional uses of water that need to be tackled in a world of growing demand
Elimination of waste alone can potentially provide over sixty percent more food for the growing world population.

sentences.en: A growing youth has a wolf in his belly.
sentences.cn: 年轻人,在成长,吃起饭来像饿狼。

sentences.en: a growing awareness of healthy living
sentences.cn: 不断增强的健康生活的意识

sentences.en: a growing consciousness of environmental issues among children
sentences.cn: 儿童对环境问题不断提高的意识

sentences.en: A growing economy covers a multitude of sins for the government.
sentences.cn: 蓬勃的经济为政府掩盖种种见不得人的东西。

sentences.en: The troubles that are affecting the company are more than just growing pains.
sentences.cn: 目前影响这家公司的问题并不仅仅是创业初期所遇到的困难。
